title: Senior Software Engineer
description_list:
Packback is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to support our mission to awaken and fuel the lifelong curiosity in every student. As a Senior Software Engineer at Packback, you will be building features that empower students and professors to have a better learning experience.
Packback’s A.I.-powered platform is used by educators in K-12 and higher education to help their students fall in love with the subject matter, drive personalized learning, and most importantly, quantify and improve student critical thinking skills.
Key job duties include communicating well, providing thoughtful feedback to teammates, pairing, actively improving our team knowledge-base, and of course, writing code. You’ll be improving our Python APIs that power Packback’s AI, supporting the integration of machine learning models in our web application, and incrementally improving our infrastructure and CI/CD pipeline. Further, this role is designed for a Senior Software Engineer ready to take the next step in their career, growing into a Team Lead position where they will balance managing other engineers with hands-on technical leadership.
Why You Should Work at Packback
Reach
 - The Packback Platform is used by more than 10 thousand educators and 1.5 million students, who collectively author more than 10 million posts a year. You will be a part of building a platform that has a huge impact on inspiring curiosity in students.
Training
 - We offer opportunities for learning and mentorship. We value people who like to wear many hats. You can get involved with the front end, back end, infrastructure and data functions.
Ownership
 - Packback is a rapidly growing company. You will have responsibility for bringing innovative features to market while working closely with the product team.
Want to learn more about engineering at Packback? Check out our docs repo on Github.
Requirements
At Packback, we are on the hunt for a dynamic individual who is enthusiastic about working on our backend, infrastructure, and data engineering landscapes. We value solid experience in backend engineering within a modern web application environment. Our technology stack includes Django with a strong focus on Natural Language Processing (NLP). However, our primary interest is in your overall prowess as a developer.
What We Expect:
- 
You should have significant experience in backend web development, ideally with modern frameworks such as Django, FastAPI, or Flask. 
- 
Strong experience in Python is crucial, especially in architecting and building high-performance services that meet rigorous reliability standards.
- 
Extensive experience in crafting thorough unit, integration, and end-to-end tests in Python.
- 
Strong skills in managing highly scalable cloud infrastructures and comfort with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform. Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, and database management is highly desirable.
- 
At least 5 years in software engineering, preferably with web-based products. We value transferable experience over just the number of years in the field.
It's a Plus if You Have:
- 
Previous experience in leading or managing engineering teams.
- 
Experience in building, validating, and deploying machine learning models, particularly in a production environment. NLP experience would be a significant bonus.
- 
Comfort with Linux/UNIX systems.
- 
Experience in startup or small company environments is appreciated.
Our commitment to diversity

- Foster collaboration with traders, product managers, and fellow software engineers across the organization

You will collaborate closely with software developers, system administrators, and other stakeholders to diagnose and troubleshoot intricate problems, employing deep technical knowledge and analytical skills. You will conduct in-depth root cause analysis, performing code reviews, and deploying solutions to address complex software challenges. Additionally, you will be involved in creating and maintaining technical documentation, participating in software testing and quality assurance activities, and assisting in the development of software enhancements and upgrades. You will be crucial in ensuring the smooth operation and optimal performance of software systems, as well as in providing guidance and support to junior support engineers.
You will be directly supporting internal or external users. You have experience in supporting users across multiple time zones. - Analyzing software problems to determine their underlying causes and developing strategies to address them. This involves examining logs, error reports, and system configurations to identify patterns or anomalies.
- Collaboration:

- Escalation Management:
- Managing the escalation of critical incidents or complex issues to appropriate stakeholders, such as senior engineers, managers, or development leads. This includes providing clear and concise communication regarding the status, impact, and recommended solutions.
- Continuous Improvement:
- Actively seeking opportunities to improve support processes, tools, and systems. Participate in post-incident reviews, suggest process enhancements, and drive initiatives to enhance customer satisfaction and reduce support incidents.
- Address complex software issues, ensuring system stability and performance, collaborating with other teams, developing fixes, optimizing performance, documenting solutions, managing escalations, and driving continuous improvement efforts. description_list:
Jackbox Games is a leading video game company known for creating innovative and engaging party games that can be played across various platforms, including consoles, computers, and mobile devices. Our games, such as "The Jackbox Party Pack" series and titles such as “Quiplash” and “Fibbage” have become a hit among gamers and non-gamers alike, providing laughter and entertainment at social gatherings around the world.
As a Full-Stack Software Engineer at Jackbox Games, you will play a crucial role in the development and maintenance of our cutting-edge multiplayer systems. You will work closely with a talented team of engineers, designers, and artists to create captivating experiences that bring people together through interactive entertainment.
Note: This is not a game developer role.
Responsibilities:
- Develop and maintain both server-side and client-side software components using Go (Golang) and Vue.js frameworks.
- Collaborate with the game-play engineering team to design and implement scalable, high-performance systems for multiplayer games.
- Participate in the entire software development life cycle, including planning, design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
- Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code, following industry best practices and coding standards.
- Optimize system performance and troubleshoot technical issues to ensure smooth gameplay and user experiences.
- Integrate and interact with various APIs and third-party services to enhance systems and tooling functionality.
- Work closely with designers and artists to implement game features, UI elements, and animations.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve development processes and workflows.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in full-stack development, web technologies, and industry best practices.
- Contribute to code reviews, knowledge sharing, and mentorship to foster a collaborative and learning environment.
Requirements
- Proven experience as a Full-Stack Software Engineer, with a focus on back-end development using Go and front-end development using Vue.js.
- Strong proficiency in Go (Golang) programming language and Vue.js (or comparable) framework.
- Experience with dynamically scaling multi-user environments and real-time communication protocols is highly desirable.
Nice to have qualifications:
- Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure.
- Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
- Understanding of network programming and security principles in a multi-user context.
Benefits
Okay, but what are the perks?!
- Pay range: $101,000 -$137,000. Please note: individual compensation packages are based on various factors unique to each candidate and position, including (but not limited to) skill set, experience and qualifications.
- Other benefits: 401(k) with matching. We pay 100% of the cost of premiums for medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance for our employees. We also cover a really nice chunk of the cost of premiums for spouse/partner/dependent medical, dental and vision insurance. Paid parental leave.
- Flexible work schedule and environment. Our employees are encouraged to work where they feel the safest and most productive. Our office in Lincoln Park in Chicago is open (and fully stocked with snacks) for folks that prefer to work in the office. Due to various legal and tax implications we can only offer employment to residents of the following states: California, Connecticut, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Washington, Wisconsin.
- Flexible PTO. Take time off when you need to recharge, take a trip, or just catch up on life.
- Annual stipends for therapy, education, wellness and home office equipment to encourage our employees’ lifelong learning pursuits and support mental and physical health.
- Creative work environment. We are lucky to work in a place that is full of talented and innovative folks. Most of the day, the place is pretty quiet (we’re a focused bunch), but this is punctuated with hilarious outbursts and general merriment.
Interested?
Great, we look forward to reading your application. Please include:
- Your resume.
- A cover letter. You don't need to be a professional writer for this job (we have those) but we would love to hear more about you that we can't see from your resume.
On the fence? If you're interested in the job but worried you aren't qualified, we encourage you to err on the side of applying. We'd hate to miss out on great candidates just because they're worried they don't check every box on the job description.
We know it is a time commitment to prepare an application and we respect that effort by thoughtfully reviewing every complete application and responding one way or the other. But that kind of thoughtful review means that it sometimes takes us a while to get back to applicants, so please be patient with us and no phone calls.
Thanks for your interest in Jackbox Games!

- Optimize system performance and troubleshoot technical issues to ensure smooth gameplay and user experiences.
- Integrate and interact with various APIs and third-party services to enhance systems and tooling functionality.
- Work closely with designers and artists to implement game features, UI elements, and animations.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve development processes and workflows.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in full-stack development, web technologies, and industry best practices.
- Contribute to code reviews, knowledge sharing, and mentorship to foster a collaborative and learning environment.

- Proven experience as a Full-Stack Software Engineer, with a focus on back-end development using Go and front-end development using Vue.js.
- Strong proficiency in Go (Golang) programming language and Vue.js (or comparable) framework.
- Experience with dynamically scaling multi-user environments and real-time communication protocols is highly desirable.

- Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure.
- Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
- Understanding of network programming and security principles in a multi-user context.
